meanings.definition: Study (something) again in order to learn or memorize it.
meanings.sent1: She restudied the math problems to make sure she understood them.
meanings.sent2: He always restudies his notes before a big test.
meanings.sent3: The student restudied the history facts and felt like a walking encyclopedia.
meanings.sent4: Her mind was a library, constantly restudying the books of knowledge.
meanings.sent5: The idea of restudying the map made the geography lesson stick in her mind.

meanings.definition: To review or go over material that has been previously studied.
meanings.sent1: They restudied the science experiment to see where they went wrong.
meanings.sent2: After class, she always restudies her notes to reinforce the information.
meanings.sent3: The detective restudied the clues, hoping to find the missing piece of the puzzle.
meanings.sent4: His mind was like a filing cabinet, constantly restudying the information stored inside.
meanings.sent5: The idea of restudying the map made the geography lesson stick in her mind.
